titlegrp.title: Quantifying predation attempts on arboreal marsupials using wildlife crossing structures above a major road

author.details: School of Ecosystem and Forest Sciences, The University of Melbourne, Parkville, Vic. 3052, Australia.
Australian Research Centre for Urban Ecology, Royal Botanic Gardens Victoria, South Yarra, Vic. 3141, Australia.
Australian Research Centre for Urban Ecology, Royal Botanic Gardens Victoria, South Yarra, Vic. 3141, Australia.

front.abstract: We review eight years of monitoring data to quantify the number of predation attempts on arboreal marsupials using canopy bridges and glider poles across a major road in south-east Australia. We recorded 13488 detections of arboreal marsupials on the structures, yet only a single (and unsuccessful) predation attempt was recorded.
front.keywords: canopy bridge, glider pole, predator–prey interaction, road ecology.
